Package appDomain

Class WordTracker

java.lang.Object
appDomain.WordTracker
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class WordTracker extends Object implements Serializable
The WordTracker class processes text files to track the occurrence of words, including the files and line numbers where they appear. It uses a binary search tree (BST) to store this information.
See Also:

      private void processFile(String filePath)

      Parameters:

    • addWordToTree

      private void addWordToTree(String word, String filePath, int lineNumber)
      Adds a word to the tree, updating existing entries or adding new ones.
      Parameters:
      word - The word to add
      filePath - The file where the word was found
      lineNumber - The line number where the word was found

    • inorder

      public void inorder(String printOption, String filePath)
      Generates a report based on the tree and writes it to a file or prints it to the console.
      Parameters:
      printOption - The print option (-pf, -pl, -po)
      filePath - The path to the output file

    • inorderRec

      private StringBuilder inorderRec(BSTreeNode<String> root, String printOption)
      Recursively traverses the tree to generate the report.
      Parameters:
      root - The root node of the tree
      printOption - The print option (-pf, -pl, -po)
      Returns:
      The generated report as a StringBuilder
